trans-unit.source: Get Started with authentication for Mobile Apps in Xamarin Android
trans-unit.target: Get Started with authentication for Mobile Apps in Xamarin Android

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use Mobile Apps to authenticate users of your Xamarin Android app through a variety of identity providers, including AAD, Google, Facebook, Twitter, and Microsoft.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use Mobile Apps to authenticate users of your Xamarin Android app through a variety of identity providers, including AAD, Google, Facebook, Twitter, and Microsoft.

trans-unit.source: Add authentication to your Xamarin.Android app
trans-unit.target: Add authentication to your Xamarin.Android app

trans-unit.source: This topic shows you how to authenticate users of a Mobile App from your client application.
trans-unit.target: This topic shows you how to authenticate users of a Mobile App from your client application.

trans-unit.source: In this tutorial, you add authentication to the quickstart project using an identity provider that is supported by Azure Mobile Apps.
trans-unit.target: In this tutorial, you add authentication to the quickstart project using an identity provider that is supported by Azure Mobile Apps.

trans-unit.source: After being successfully authenticated and authorized in the Mobile App, the user ID value is displayed.
trans-unit.target: After being successfully authenticated and authorized in the Mobile App, the user ID value is displayed.

trans-unit.source: This tutorial is based on the Mobile App quickstart.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial is based on the Mobile App quickstart.

trans-unit.source: You must also first complete the tutorial [Create a Xamarin.Android app].
trans-unit.target: You must also first complete the tutorial [Create a Xamarin.Android app].

trans-unit.source: If you do not use the downloaded quick start server project, you must add the authentication extension package to your project.
trans-unit.target: If you do not use the downloaded quick start server project, you must add the authentication extension package to your project.

trans-unit.source: For more information about server extension packages, see [Work with the .NET backend server SDK for Azure Mobile Apps](app-service-mobile-dotnet-backend-how-to-use-server-sdk.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information about server extension packages, see [Work with the .NET backend server SDK for Azure Mobile Apps](app-service-mobile-dotnet-backend-how-to-use-server-sdk.md).

trans-unit.source: Create an App Service Gateway
trans-unit.target: Create an App Service Gateway

trans-unit.source: Register your app for authentication and configure App Services
trans-unit.target: Register your app for authentication and configure App Services

trans-unit.source: Restrict permissions to authenticated users
trans-unit.target: Restrict permissions to authenticated users

trans-unit.source: In Visual Studio or Xamarin Studio, run the client project on a device or emulator.
trans-unit.target: In Visual Studio or Xamarin Studio, run the client project on a device or emulator.

trans-unit.source: Verify that an unhandled exception with a status code of 401 (Unauthorized) is raised after the app starts.
trans-unit.target: Verify that an unhandled exception with a status code of 401 (Unauthorized) is raised after the app starts.

trans-unit.source: Next, you will update the client app to request resources from the Mobile App backend with an authenticated user.
trans-unit.target: Next, you will update the client app to request resources from the Mobile App backend with an authenticated user.

trans-unit.source: Add authentication to the app
trans-unit.target: Add authentication to the app

trans-unit.source: Add the following property to the **TodoActivity** class:
trans-unit.target: Add the following property to the **TodoActivity** class:

trans-unit.source: Add the following method to the **TodoActivity** class:
trans-unit.target: Add the following method to the **TodoActivity** class:

trans-unit.source: This creates a new method to authenticate a user.
trans-unit.target: This creates a new method to authenticate a user.

trans-unit.source: The user in the example code above is authenticated by using a Facebook login.
trans-unit.target: The user in the example code above is authenticated by using a Facebook login.

trans-unit.source: A dialog is used to display the user ID once authenticated.
trans-unit.target: A dialog is used to display the user ID once authenticated.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] If you are using an identity provider other than Facebook, change the value passed to **LoginAsync** above to one of the following: _MicrosoftAccount_, _Twitter_, _Google_, or _WindowsAzureActiveDirectory_.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] If you are using an identity provider other than Facebook, change the value passed to **LoginAsync** above to one of the following: _MicrosoftAccount_, _Twitter_, _Google_, or _WindowsAzureActiveDirectory_.

trans-unit.source: In the **OnCreate** method, add the following line of code after the code that instantiates the `MobileServiceClient` object.
trans-unit.target: In the **OnCreate** method, add the following line of code after the code that instantiates the `MobileServiceClient` object.

trans-unit.source: This call starts the authentication process and awaits it asynchronously.
trans-unit.target: This call starts the authentication process and awaits it asynchronously.

trans-unit.source: In Visual Studio or Xamarin Studio, run the client project on a device or emulator and sign in with your chosen identity provider.
trans-unit.target: In Visual Studio or Xamarin Studio, run the client project on a device or emulator and sign in with your chosen identity provider.

trans-unit.source: When you are successfully logged-in, the app will display your login id and the list of todo items, and you can make updates to the data.
trans-unit.target: When you are successfully logged-in, the app will display your login id and the list of todo items, and you can make updates to the data.

trans-unit.source: test
trans-unit.target: test
